body.p: Which one of the following best describes the operation of the CPU on the machine code instructions in RAM?

multiple_choice.choice: The CPU compares the bytes of adjacent instructions to discover differing bits.
The CPU sets the "run" bit to 1 within each instruction byte.
The CPU runs the first instruction, then the second, and so on.
The CPU swaps the instructions around, so the first is last and the last is first.

response.feedback: The CPU works on the bytes, but not comparing.
The CPU does something with the instruction, not changing it.
The CPU runs each instruction in turn.
The CPU does something with the instructions, not moving them around.
